meanings.definition: The announcement of the Incarnation by the angel Gabriel to Mary.
meanings.sent1: The annunciation of the good news brought joy to Mary.
meanings.sent2: The annunciation of the winner was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent3: The annunciation of a surprise party was almost spoiled by the excited guests.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an annunciation of her happiness to the world.
meanings.sent5: The annunciation of the royal decree echoed through the halls of the palace.

meanings.definition: The act of announcing or proclaiming something.
meanings.sent1: His loud annunciation of the new rule caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The annunciation of the weather forecast was broadcasted on TV.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's annunciation of random words amused the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The annunciation of the verdict left the courtroom in silence.
meanings.sent5: The clear annunciation of the teacher helped the students understand the lesson better.
